page.title: 05Painswick
page.content: In all of England there are few places like the delightful village of Painswick with its grey stone houses and 15th century church.The walls of the church are still red in some places from the flames which forced the parliamentary men to surrender in the civil war.A legend has it that there can never be more than 99 Yew trees around the church and that all attempts to plant 100th have failed. But when we counted we found 120 yew trees!.In the church,in 1540 Sir William Kingston governor of the tower of London was buried. Many motorists on the lovely run slow down to see the old grey Court House with tall chimneys and many gables.
